architecture_overview: The dokploy architecture likely involves a frontend for user interaction, a backend for processing logic, a database for storing configurations, and deployment services for executing tasks.

components.name: Frontend
components.description: User interface for interacting with deployment workflows and configurations

components.name: Backend
components.description: API layer handling request routing, authentication, and orchestration logic

components.name: Database
components.description: Persistent storage for deployment configurations, secrets, and metadata

components.name: Deployment Service
components.description: Worker service executing deployment tasks on target infrastructure

data_flows.description: User input and authentication tokens flow between frontend and backend
Deployment configurations and secrets are stored/retrieved from the database
Deployment instructions and credentials are sent to execution workers
Status updates and logs are returned to the backend for user visibility

security_considerations: Ensure strict authentication/authorization between frontend and backend
Encrypt sensitive data in transit between components
Secure storage of secrets in the database with access controls
Validate and sanitize all user inputs to prevent injection attacks

trust_boundaries.name: Untrusted Frontend
trust_boundaries.description: Frontend interface exposed to public internet with no direct access to backend systems

trust_boundaries.name: Trusted Backend & Database
trust_boundaries.description: Internal network with strict access controls for processing and storage components
